qas.question: What did the May Fourth movement help do?

answers.text: rekindle the then-fading cause of republican revolution.

qas.question: Sun Yat-Sen became the leader of what military group.

answers.text: a rival military government in Guangzhou

qas.question: What did Sun Yat-Sen hope to get from western democracies?
Who did Sun Yet-Sen turn in 1930 for help?
How did the Soviets try to befriend  the Chinese Revolutionist?

answers.text: by offering scathing attacks on Western imperialism.

context: The May Fourth Movement helped to <a0_0>rekindle the then-fading cause of republican revolution.<a0_0/> In 1917 Sun Yat-sen had become commander-in-chief of <a1_0>a rival military government in Guangzhou<a1_0/> in collaboration with southern warlords. Sun's efforts to obtain <a2_0>aid<a2_0/> from the Western democracies were ignored, however, and in 1920 he turned to <a3_0>the Soviet Union<a3_0/>, which had recently achieved its own revolution. The Soviets sought to befriend the Chinese revolutionists <a4_0>by offering scathing attacks on Western imperialism.<a4_0/> But for political expediency, the Soviet leadership initiated a dual policy of support for both Sun and the newly established Chinese Communist Party (CCP).
